extends Object

Type for specifying axis styles.

Are the tick marks drawn?

Returns:
are the tick marks displayed? Can be null if it was never set.

setDrawTickMarks

public void setDrawTickMarks(boolean drawTickMarks)
The developer can override default tick mark behavior with this method.

Parameters:

getTickMarkLength

public Integer getTickMarkLength()
Get the tick mark length. Can be negative.

Returns:
the tickMarkLength

setTickMarkLength

public void setTickMarkLength(int tickMarkLength)
Set the tick mark length. Can be negative. Will also implicitly call setDrawTickMarks(boolean) with true.

Parameters:
tickMarkLength - the tickMarkLength to set

newAxisStyle

public static AxisStyle newAxisStyle(Color textColor,
                                     int fontSize,
                                     AxisTextAlignment alignment)
Define an axis style.

Parameters:
textColor - color of text displayed along the axis. Cannot be null.
fontSize - font size of text displayed along the axis. Must be > 0.
alignment - alignment of text along the axis with respect to the axis tick marks. Only works for horizontal axes. Cannot be null.
Returns:
the new constructed axis style
